Philippine: SuperFerry 14 is bombed by the Abu Sayyaf, then sinks near Manila Bay, killing 116.
Supreme Court vote, 8-5, to declare then Presidential candidate Fernando Poe Jr. as a natural-born Filipino and qualified to run for President.
Philippine general election, 2004 (Gloria Macapagal–Arroyo elected to a six-year term)
Death of Enrique Fernando, former Chief Justice.
A Philippine National Railways train crashes in Padre Burgos, Quezon, killing 12.
Hacienda Luisita massacre occurred, 14 were killed.

Cyclones Muifa (Unding), Merbok (Violeta), Winnie and Nanmadol (Yoyong) hit the country, affecting million people, causing massive fatalities and damages.
  • In November, a tropical depression (Winnie) kills more than 1,500 people, causes damages of estimated ₱679 million (US$15.8 million).
  • Cyclone Nanmadol (Yoyong) strikes the country, killing 70 people.
Death of Fernando Poe, Jr., action film star
